newsitem.title: USA: Crystal Oil to acquire Louisiana reserves.
newsitem.headline: Crystal Oil to acquire Louisiana reserves.

text.p: Crystal Oil Co said Thursday it has agreed to acquire various proved producing and undeveloped reserves in Louisiana for $12 million in cash.

The properties are the Bethany-Longstreet and Holly Fields in DeSoto Parish, Louisiana. Crystal said they had estimated net proved reserves of more than 28 billion cubic feet of gas and 38,000 barrels of condensate on March 1.
Crystal said it is considering drilling about 20 wells in the fields over the next three years, starting later this year, to supplement an existing 16 producing wells.
The company said it does not plan to hire substantially more employees and will consolidate the acquired operations with its exploration and production activities in Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas.

It said it would fund the acquisition and future capital expenditures through a forward sale of production and the establishment of various hedge positions. It said it may use a portion of its existing cash for the acquisition.
Crystal said it expects to close the deal by the end of May.
